It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Legal] 1846, Dec. 7, Washington County, Tennessee [to] Jonathan S. Henly and Thomas S. Henly
bibl.note: This is a legal document dated December 7, 1846 from Washington County Court, witnessed by William H. Smith. It states that Jonathan S. Henly and Thomas S. Henly are empowered to execute the last will and testament of Isaac Henly.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

address.addrLine:
To Jonathan S. Henly and Thomas
S Henly

div.p: Whereas, the last Will and Testament of Isaac Henly deceased, has been exhibited and proven in our County Court of Washington County, and you, the Executor, named therein, having given bond and security, and taken the oath of Executor, the Court ordered that Letters Testamentary be issued to you. These are therefore to empower you, the said J Jonathan S Henly & T Thomas S Henly to enter upon the execution of said Will, and to collect and administer all the property of the Testator, agreeable to the provisions of said Will and the laws of the land requiring you to make and exhibit an Inventory and an account of sales, and to make settlement of said estate according to law. Witness, William H Smith Clerk of said Court, at office, the 7th day of December 1846

closer.signed: W William H Smith Clk Clerk
closer.add:
Letters
Testamentary
To
JS Henly
& TS Henly
